title-part.text: SELECTION OF MATERIALS FOR THEIR CONDUCTIVE, INSULATING OR DIELECTRIC PROPERTIES

reference.text: selection for magnetic properties H01F1/00; waveguides H01P

note.note-paragraph: Group H01B12/00 takes precedence over groups H01B5/00 - H01B11/00.
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Conductors or conductive bodies characterised by the conductive materials

note.note-paragraph: Groups H01B1/14 - H01B1/24 take precedence over groups H01B1/02 - H01B1/12

title-part.text: mainly consisting of metals or alloys
mainly consisting of carbon-silicon compounds, carbon or silicon
mainly consisting of other non-metallic substances

reference.text: organic macromolecular compounds or compositions C08

CPC-specific-text.text: comprising aliphatic main chains, e.g. polyactylenes
comprising five-membered aromatic rings in the main chain, e.g. polypyrroles, polythiophenes
comprising six-membered aromatic rings in the main chain, e.g. polyanilines, polyphenylenes

title-part.text: Conductive material dispersed in non-conductive inorganic material
the conductive material comprising metals or alloys
the conductive material comprising carbon-silicon compounds, carbon or silicon
Conductive material dispersed in non-conductive organic material

reference.text: organic macromolecular compounds or compositions C08

title-part.text: the conductive material comprising metals or alloys
the conductive material comprising carbon-silicon compounds, carbon or silicon
Insulators or insulating bodies characterised by the insulating materials
Selection of materials for their insulating or dielectric properties

CPC-specific-text.text: with conductive additives or conductive layers
Wires with glass or glass wool
Glass or glass wool in binder
Shaping of glass or deposition of glass

reference.text: organic macromolecular compounds or compositions C08

title-part.text: containing halogen in the molecules, e.g. halogenated oils

note.note-paragraph: Group H01B3/47 takes precedence over groups H01B3/32 - H01B3/46

CPC-specific-text.text: Macromolecular compounds obtained by reactions forming a linkage containing sulfur with or without nitrogen, oxygen or carbon in the main chain of the macromolecule, not provided for in group H01B3/302
Polyurethanes or polythiourethanes; Polyurea or polythiourea

Macromolecular compounds obtained by reactions forming a linkage containing nitrogen with or without oxygen or carbon in the main chain of the macromolecule, not provided for in groups H01B3/38 or H01B3/302

title-part.text: condensation products of phenols with aldehydes or ketones
condensation products of aldehydes with amines or amides

CPC-specific-text.text: Linear saturated polyesters derived from dicarboxylic acids and dihydroxy compounds
Non-saturated polyesters derived from polycarboxylic acids and polyhydroxy compounds, in which at least one of the two components contains aliphatic unsaturation
from vinylhalogenides or other halogenoethylenic compounds
from vinylfluorides or other fluoroethylenic compounds

title-part.text: Non-insulated conductors or conductive bodies characterised by their form
Single bars, rods, wires, or strips
Several wires or the like stranded in the form of a rope
stranded around a space, insulating material, or dissimilar conducting material

CPC-specific-text.text: stranded around a high tensile strength core
composed of metallic wires, e.g. steel wires
composed of synthetic filaments, e.g. glass-fibres
stranded around a core supporting radial stresses, e.g. a tube, a wire helix
stranded around communication or control conductors

title-part.text: comprising conductive layers or films on insulating-supports
comprising conductive material in insulating or poorly conductive material, e.g. conductive rubber

reference.text: H01B1/14, H01B1/20 take precedence; insulating bodies with conductive admixtures H01B17/64; conductive paints C09D5/24

title-part.text: Insulated conductors or cables characterised by their form

CPC-specific-text.text: Details relating to the conductive cores
Electrical cables comprising fluid supply conductors
Cables with built-in connecting points or with predetermined areas for making deviations
Cables with several layers of insulating material
Cables with a predominant gas dielectric
comprising one or more helical wrapped layers of insulation
comprising in addition one or more other layers of non-helical wrapped insulation
comprising one or more longitudinal lapped layers of insulation
comprising one or more braided layers of insulation
comprising one or more extruded layers of insulation
comprising in addition one or more other layers of non-extruded insulation
comprising two or more layers of insulation having different electrical properties

title-part.text: Flexible cables, conductors, or cords, e.g. trailing cables

CPC-specific-text.text: attached to mobile objects, e.g. portable tools, elevators, mining equipment, hoisting cables
attached to flying objects, e.g. aircraft towline, cables connecting an aerodyne to the ground
attached to marine objects, e.g. buoys, diving equipment, aquatic probes, marine towline
attached to objects sunk in bore holes, e.g. well drilling means, well pumps
for implantation into a human or animal body, e.g. pacemaker leads

title-part.text: Extensible conductors or cables, e.g. self-coiling cords

CPC-specific-text.text: having the shape of an helix
Parallel wires, incorporated in a flat insulating profile
Parallel wires, incorporated in a fabric
Parallel wires, sandwiched between two insulating layers
Parallel wires, fixed upon a support layer
Juxtaposed parallel wires, fixed to each other without a support layer
comprising one or more armouring, tensile- or compression-resistant elements
incorporated in a cable of non-flat configuration

title-part.text: Contact cables, i.e. having conductors which may be brought into contact by distortion of the cable
Protection against damage caused by external factors, e.g. sheaths or armouring
by wear, mechanical force or pressure;

CPC-specific-text.text: Protections not provided for in groups H01B7/182 - H01B7/26
forming part of a high tensile strength core
forming part of an outer sheath
Sheaths comprising grooves, ribs or other projections
Sheaths comprising internal cavities or channels
Sheaths comprising helical wrapped non-metallic layers
Sheaths comprising longitudinal lapped non-metallic layers
Radial force absorbing layers providing a cushioning effect

title-part.text: Metal wires or tapes, e.g. made of steel

CPC-specific-text.text: Longitudinally placed metal wires or tapes
forming part of a high tensile strength core
forming part of an outer sheath
Helicoidally wound metal wires or tapes

title-part.text: Devices affording localised protection against mechanical force or pressure
Reduction of losses in sheaths or armouring
by moisture, corrosion, chemical attack or weather

CPC-specific-text.text: Protection against damage caused by corrosion
Protection against damage caused by electrical, chemical or water tree deterioration

title-part.text: by completely or partially filling interstices in the cable
using hygroscopic material or material swelling in the presence of liquid
Protection against damage caused by extremes of temperature or by flame
with arrangements for reducing conductor losses when carrying alternating current, e.g. due to skin effect
with arrangements for indicating defects, e.g. breaks or leaks

CPC-specific-text.text: being the colour of the insulation or conductor
being the form of the insulation or conductor
being indicia imposed on the insulation or conductor
being a tape, thread or wire extending the full length of the conductor or cable
being a sleeve, ferrule, tag, clip, label or short length strip

title-part.text: with arrangements for facilitating removal of insulation

CPC-specific-text.text: comprising a rip cord or wire

title-part.text: with arrangements for facilitating mounting or securing
with arrangements for heat dissipation or conduction

CPC-specific-text.text: Power supply cables for the electrodes of electric-welding apparatus or electric-arc furnaces
including electrical control or communication wires
Constructional features relating to the conductors

title-part.text: with screens or conductive layers, e.g. for avoiding large potential gradients

CPC-specific-text.text: Features relating to screening tape per se
with screen grounding means, e.g. drain wires

title-part.text: Cables for use in conduits under fluid pressure

CPC-specific-text.text: Cables for use in conduits under gas-pressure
Cables for use in conduits under oil-pressure
Expansion-absorbing apparatus, enclosed within the cable
Features relating to the conductors of gas-pressure cables
Features relating to the dielectric of gas-pressure cables
having the shape of a disc
Features relating to the enclosing sheath of gas-pressure cables
Features relating to the conductors of oil-pressure cables
Features relating to the dielectric of oil-pressure cables
Features relating to the enclosing sheath of oil-pressure cables

title-part.text: Cables with twisted pairs or quads
with pairs or quads mutually positioned to reduce cross-talk
with means for reducing effects of electromagnetic or electrostatic disturbances, e.g. screens
Screens specially adapted for reducing cross-talk
Screens specially adapted for reducing interference from external sources

CPC-specific-text.text: Features relating to screening tape per se
composed of a longitudinal lapped tape-conductor
composed of a helicoidally wound tape-conductor
composed of a helicoidally wound wire-conductor
composed of a longitudinally posed wire-conductor
using a coating, e.g. a loaded polymer, ink or print
the coating containing conductive or semiconductive material
the coating being applied by printing
with screen grounding means, e.g. drain wires

title-part.text: Arrangements for exhibiting specific transmission characteristics
Continuously inductively loaded cables, e.g. Krarup cables
Cables, e.g. submarine cables, with coils or other devices incorporated during cable manufacture
Analogous cables having more than one inner conductor within a common outer conductor

note.note-paragraph: If suitable for handling frequencies considerably beyond the audio range and if typical HF-features of coaxial cables are disclosed, e.g. propagation of non-TEM modes, multimoding, oversized coaxial cables, particular cross-section adapted for HF-propagation, classification is made in H01P3/06

CPC-specific-text.text: Construction of the space inside the hollow inner conductor
Co-axial cables with at least one braided conductor
Co-axial cables with at least one metal deposit conductor
Co-axial cables with at least one wire-wound conductor
Co-axial cables with at least one longitudinal lapped tape-conductor
Co-axial cables with at least one helicoidally wound tape-conductor
Construction of the insulation between the conductors
having the shape of a disc
having the shape of a bead
Construction of the layers on the outer side of the outer conductor
Measures for the conductors, in order to fix the spacers
Special measures in order to improve the flexibility
Special measures in order to improve the refrigeration
Special measures in order to improve the centration of the inner conductor

title-part.text: Cables having a multiplicity of coaxial lines
Cables including at least one electrical conductor together with optical fibres
Superconductive or hyperconductive conductors, cables, or transmission lines

note.note-paragraph: Group H01B12/12 takes precedence over groups H01B12/04 - H01B12/10.

title-part.text: Films or wires on bases or cores
characterised by the disposition of thermal insulation
Apparatus or processes specially adapted for manufacturing conductors or cables

Insulating conductors with lacquers or enamels

Detecting breakage or run-out of winding material

the conductor having a rectangular cross-section
of two or more insulating layers
with a special opening of the extrusion head

Controlling the extrusion apparatus dependent on the capacitance or the thickness of the insulating material

using a filling or coating bath
